duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide clinical and technical support for school based health center (SBHC) medical providers.
Ensure appropriate supplies and equipment are stocked in the SBHC and perform clinical testing according to OSHA and CLIA standards.
Enroll patients in the SBHC and bill for services rendered.
Greet patients, parents, school faculty, and staff, and identify uninsured and underinsured patients.
Escort patients to room, obtain chief complaint, and document appropriately in electronic medical record.
Perform CLIA waived laboratory tests in accordance with established policy and procedures.
Set up clinical operatory and provide assistance required by provider.
Ensure adequate level of clinical supplies and materials through monitoring of clinical inventory and timely restocking.
Maintain daily log books for all CLIA waived procedures and ensure timely billing of medical and behavioral health services.
Support communication among clinical team members by accurately taking phone messages and relaying them in a timely manner.
Maintain universal precautions within the clinical setting at all times and participates in continuous performance improvement activities.
Serve as facilities Safety Officer and lead or participate in special projects.
Meet regularly with Regional Directors, Nurse Managers, and Program Managers to discuss operational issues and problem solve.
Assist in creating agenda for regular SBHC MA meetings.

education_certification.credential: High school diploma or equivalency, completion of a Medical Assistant course from an accredited/recognized school, and current American Red Cross CPR for the Professional Rescuer and AED (CPR/FPR/AED) certification. Prior demonstrated excellent communication and customer service skills.
